intro: Achyrospermum seychellarum, commonly known as the Seychelles moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a notable species in botanical studies.
